data.title_jp: 【閲覧注意】後ろに誰かいる…さとるくんの呪い
data.description: What would you do if a ghost was tracking your location in real-time? Satoru-kun is one of Japan's most terrifying urban legends. This ritual involves calling your own phone from a public booth. He will call you back, getting closer with every sentence until he is right behind you. Would you dare to ask him a question, or would you run? Japanese Horror and Supernatural urban legends often use everyday technology like smartphones to bridge the gap between our world and the spirit realm. This creepy story explores the physical distance of fear. Do you believe in urban legends? Tell us your scariest experience in the comments below! This is a legendary J-Horror tale that reminds us: never call your own number at night.
data.editorial_notes: Viral Architectによるタイトル案：1. NEVER Answer This Call: Satoru-kun, 2. WARNING: 10cm Away... The Satoru-kun Ritual, 3. The Secret Phone Ritual of Japan. 協議の結果、物理的な距離（10cm）を強調し視聴者の本能的な恐怖を煽る案2を選定。The Whispererは『距離が縮まる恐怖』をナレーションに込め、文末の句点を排除してVrewの読み上げ精度を最適化。The Visionaryは90年代Jホラーの質感を再現するため、Grainy filmと35mmレンズの設定を全プロンプトに共通採用し、一貫した不気味さを演出しました。
data.vrew_script:
Have you heard of the boy who knows everything
Find a public phone at the edge of town
Drop a coin and call your own number
Satoru-kun Satoru-kun please come to me
The phone rings but no one is there
Then your pocket vibrates with a cold chill
I am at the station he whispers
Every second the voice gets closer
I am at your front door now
I am right behind you he breathes
Ask your question but do not turn around
If you look back he will drag you away
Can you feel his breath on your neck
